en: 2015 EU Prize for Contemporary Architecture – Mies van der Rohe Award Ceremony
The award ceremony of the most prestigious European architecture award will be held on 8 May in Barcelona, Spain.
2015 EU Prize for Contemporary Architecture – Mies van der Rohe Award Ceremony
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
The award ceremony of the most prestigious European architecture award will be held on 8 May in Barcelona, Spain.

The event will take place at the Mies van der Rohe Pavilion, a building that is an architectural reference point in itself.

The 2015 winner will be announced on this occasion, selected from the five finalists announced on 25 February. The Emerging Architect winner will also be under the spotlight.

This year buildings from Denmark, Germany, Italy, Poland and the United Kingdom are represented among the finalists.

On 7 May, at an event open to all the public, each finalist will have a chance to present their projects.

Only once the architects have shared their work, and the visions and ideas that underpin them, will the jury make their final decision.

The jury's decisions will also be based on a research visit that is currently ongoing at each site.

This process gives the panel the chance to see the works in their surroundings and to investigate how users interact with the buildings day-to-day.

The event will not only celebrate the winners' success but will recognise the work of all the architects and people involved in the prize.

If you are in Barcelona on 7 and 8 May or have a particular passion for European architecture, make sure to get the dates in your calendar.

The events will be covered closely both here and on social media, so stay tuned for updates and coverage.
